| Type | Scroll                                                                                                     |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Scroll of brand weapon                                                                                     |
| Icon | [![Scroll of brand weapon.png](/images/a/a9/Scroll_of_brand_weapon.png)](/File:Scroll_of_brand_weapon.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A scroll that imbues a weapon with a random brand. Any existing brand will be replaced with a different one, and any brand forbidden by your current god will not be chosen. Artefacts cannot be branded in this way. |

Upon reading a **scroll of brand weapon**, you will be asked to choose a non-[artefact](/Artefact "Artefact") weapon from your inventory to receive a permanent, randomly-selected [brand](/Brand "Brand"). This will also replace any brand currently on the targeted weapon, if any.

If you have already [identified](/Identified "Identified") the scroll, you may cancel the process by pressing **Esc** without consuming it.

Melee and ranged weapons have different sets of possible brands:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Brand Likelihood

**Melee Weapons**

- Common: 13.3%

  - [Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming")
  - [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing")
  - [Heavy](/Heavy "Heavy")
  - [Venom](/Venom "Venom")
  - [Protection](/Protection "Protection")

- Rare: 6.6%

  - [Draining](/Draining "Draining")
  - [Electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution")
  - [Spectral](/Spectral_\(brand\) "Spectral (brand)")
  - [Vampiric](/Vampiric "Vampiric")
  - [Chaos](/Chaos "Chaos")

**Ranged Weapons**

- Common: 21.4%

  - [Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming")
  - [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing")
  - [Heavy](/Heavy "Heavy")
  - [Draining](/Draining "Draining")

- Rare: 7.1%

  - [Electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution")
  - [Chaos](/Chaos "Chaos")

The selected brand will be automatically rerolled in two cases:

- the new brand is identical to the weapon's former brand;
- your [god](/God "God") disapproves of the selected brand.

Note that the scroll cannot give the [antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic"), [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath"), [pain](/Pain_\(brand\) "Pain (brand)"), or [speed](/Speed_\(brand\) "Speed (brand)") brands to weapons. Additionally, ranged weapons can't get the [penetration](/Penetration "Penetration") brand from this scroll.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), the heavy brand did not exist; it replaced the [vorpal](/Vorpal "Vorpal") brand. Also, ranged weapons could get [venom](/Venom "Venom") instead of [draining](/Draining_\(brand\) "Draining (brand)").

- In [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), brand likelihood was changed to be more uniform.

- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), the spectral brand did not exist.

- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), rebranding a [distortion](/Distortion "Distortion") weapon would trigger a distortion unwield effect. Also, the scroll would automatically affect your wielded weapon, rather than letting you choose a target.

- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), you could control which brand you received to some extent: any temporary brand your wielded weapon held upon reading would be made permanent. Additionally, any time you gave your weapon one of the following brands, you would receive the following effect:

  - [Flame](/Flame "Flame")/[Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming"): [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame") explosion centered on the reader
  - [Frost](/Frost "Frost")/[Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing"): [Ozocubu's Refrigeration](/Ozocubu%27s_Refrigeration "Ozocubu's Refrigeration")
  - [Draining](/Draining "Draining")/[Vampiricism](/Vampiricism "Vampiricism"): Moderate [draining](/Draining "Draining") to the reader
  - [Venom](/Venom "Venom"): [Olgreb's Toxic Radiance](/Olgreb%27s_Toxic_Radiance "Olgreb's Toxic Radiance")
  - [Electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution"): [Orb of Electrocution](/Orb_of_Electrocution "Orb of Electrocution") centered on the reader
  - [Chaos](/Chaos "Chaos"): [Chaos](/Chaos "Chaos")-branded explosion

  * The following temporary brands could not be affixed this way, and attempting to do so was punished as follows:

  - [Pain](/Pain_\(brand\) "Pain (brand)"): [Torment](/Torment "Torment")
  - [Distortion](/Distortion "Distortion"): A random [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") [miscast effect](/Miscast_effect "Miscast effect") (possibly including [banishment](/Banishment "Banishment"))
  - [Antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic"): Drains all your [MP](/MP "MP")

- The scroll of brand weapon was added in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), replacing the [scroll of vorpalise weapon](/Scroll_of_vorpalise_weapon "Scroll of vorpalise weapon").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [item-use.cc:3097](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/item-use.cc#L3097) (0.30.0)

Scroll of brand weapon

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Type Scroll
Name Scroll of brand weapon
Icon
A scroll that imbues a weapon with a random brand. Any existing brand will be replaced with a different one, and any brand forbidden by your current god will not be chosen. Artefacts cannot be branded in this way.

Upon reading a scroll of brand weapon, you will be asked to choose a non-artefact weapon from your inventory to receive a permanent, randomly-selected brand. This will also replace any brand currently on the targeted weapon, if any.

If you have already identified the scroll, you may cancel the process by pressing Esc without consuming it.

Melee and ranged weapons have different sets of possible brands:[1]

Brand Likelihood

Melee Weapons

  • Common: 13.3%
    • Flaming
    • Freezing
    • Heavy
    • Venom
    • Protection
  • Rare: 6.6%
    • Draining
    • Electrocution
    • Spectral
    • Vampiric
    • Chaos

Ranged Weapons

  • Common: 21.4%
    • Flaming
    • Freezing
    • Heavy
    • Draining
  • Rare: 7.1%
    • Electrocution
    • Chaos

The selected brand will be automatically rerolled in two cases:

  • the new brand is identical to the weapon's former brand;
  • your god disapproves of the selected brand.

Note that the scroll cannot give the antimagic, holy wrath, pain, or speed brands to weapons. Additionally, ranged weapons can't get the penetration brand from this scroll.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, the heavy brand did not exist; it replaced the vorpal brand. Also, ranged weapons could get venom instead of draining.
  • In 0.28, brand likelihood was changed to be more uniform.
  • Prior to 0.26, the spectral brand did not exist.
  • Prior to 0.15, rebranding a distortion weapon would trigger a distortion unwield effect. Also, the scroll would automatically affect your wielded weapon, rather than letting you choose a target.
  • Prior to 0.14, you could control which brand you received to some extent: any temporary brand your wielded weapon held upon reading would be made permanent. Additionally, any time you gave your weapon one of the following brands, you would receive the following effect:
    • Flame/Flaming: Inner Flame explosion centered on the reader
    • Frost/Freezing: Ozocubu's Refrigeration
    • Draining/Vampiricism: Moderate draining to the reader
    • Venom: Olgreb's Toxic Radiance
    • Electrocution: Orb of Electrocution centered on the reader
    • Chaos: Chaos-branded explosion
    The following temporary brands could not be affixed this way, and attempting to do so was punished as follows:
    • Pain: Torment
    • Distortion: A random Translocations miscast effect (possibly including banishment)
    • Antimagic: Drains all your MP
  • The scroll of brand weapon was added in 0.13, replacing the scroll of vorpalise weapon.

References

  1. ↑ item-use.cc:3097 (0.30.0)
